critique: The document is a delegation of authority. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is probably a sense of confidence and stability in the housing market. There isn't strong emotional language, so the scores will be relatively low. Initial scores: Joy: 3, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 2, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 2. Revised scores: Joy: 3, Sadness: 1, Anger: 1, Fear: 2, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 2.
